summary.para: Specifies a lowest and highest base address and alignment as part of an extended parameter to a function that manages virtual memory.

remarks.para: Specifying a MEM_ADDRESS_REQUIREMENTS structure with all fields set to 0 is the same as not specifying one at all.

summary.para: Specifies the lowest acceptable address. Calling <a href=" and specifying NULL for LowestStartingAddress, and specifying NULL for LowestStartingAddress, gives the same behavior as calling /.

Specifies the highest acceptable address (inclusive). This address must not exceed lpMaximumApplicationAddress returned by . Calling <a href=" and specifying NULL for LowestStartingAddress, and specifying NULL for HighestEndingAddress, gives the same behavior as calling /.
Specifies power-of-2 alignment. Specifying 0 aligns the returned address on the system allocation granularity.
